originalText.text: It is not often that I give doctors or urgent care centers 5 stars, but this is an exception. I moved to this neighborhood and this was my first time here. I have never had a good experience with urgent cares and IMO they don't have good doctors, but that is changing. The doctor here was fantastic. I was in and out in 40 minutes or so, they had the equipment and did the test needed, but the doctor knew enough to tell me what it was before the test, it was such a relief that my pain was nothing serious! I saw her correcting the nurse on an oversight showing that she cares and wants everyone to do a good job. The front staff is polite and friendly. I was called in immediately and taken care of fast. I highly recommend this urgent care center - my private doctor called while I was there and I don't even need to see my doctor anymore. Highly recommend!

originalText.text:
I had a terrific experience at the 79th and Lexington CityMD Urgent Care. My sister recommended CityMD at a location close to her but we happened to be uptown. So - it seems the service is good overall. I was a new patient and from out of state. The front desk personnel were pleasant and efficient - they got my pertinent details and gave me my choice of 3 different ways to register. Registration was a breeze and I had a very short wait.

Peter Ren did a great job at intake, took my vitals, eased my fears, and - quite rightly - let me know which of my questions he’d refer to the PA. He didn’t overstep his role and clearly provided a complete update to the PA before she came.

Lauren DeMarco, the PA, confirmed the information Peter had shared with her and did a great job listening to my concerns and further calming my fears by explaining the process and setting expectations. Both were exceptionally kind and wonderful representatives for CityMD. Lauren was highly proficient when removing the sutures. It didn’t hurt a bit even though the wound was still tender. I recommend this practice 100% and wish they could be my regular provider.

originalText.text: No x-ray technician. There should be a big sign in all caps that says this in the lobby. Instead, you may wait 1 hour and then they tell you that you have to go to a different location.

text.text: No x-ray technician. There should be a big sign in all caps that says this in the lobby. Instead, you may wait 1 hour and then they tell you that you have to go to a different location.

originalText.text: I went in for what was obviously an upper respiratory infection or bronchitis and the doctor sent me away with only nasal spray (I wasn’t even congested or having sinus issues). I went to my PCP today and I have pneumonia. Wish I wouldn’t have gone and just done a teledoc. Giving two stars because the nurses were very kind.

originalText.text: Very welcoming environment. Front desk, Samantha welcomes you with a beautiful smile, followed by the scribe, Cara and Dr. Cantor. During a really terrible day it was a relief to have individuals, shower me with positive energy, welcoming vibes, and overall a great city MD experience. Thank you so much Samantha, Cara, and Dr. Cantor for your service.
